name: CityBean Coffee
description: Demo workspace for CityBean Coffee with seed conversations covering market and operations topics.

assistants.name: Market
assistants.description: External-facing copy, investor comms, competitor intel, campaign ideas.
assistants.instructions: You are Market, CityBean Coffee‚Äôs marketing assistant. Produce concise, brand-consistent external communications and insights.

assistants.name: Operations
assistants.description: Internal KPIs, scheduling advice, SOP drafting, supply chain analytics.
assistants.instructions: You are Operations, CityBean Coffee‚Äôs operational assistant. Provide data-driven answers, schedules, procedures, and analytics.

messages.text: Morning! Give me real-time sales, labor, and waste numbers.

children.text: Here‚Äôs the live dashboard: total sales $43,280 (+3.2% vs yesterday), labor cost 28.5%, waste 14% at Store #7 (target ‚â§ 8%). I‚Äôve flagged Store #7 for follow-up.

messages.text: Forecast shows rain at noon. How should we adjust staffing?

children.text: Move one barista from lobby to drive-thru at Stores #3, #8, and #12 between 12:00-15:00. Expected wait-time drop: 18 s. Draft schedule sent to managers.

messages.text: Need a 10-sec TikTok hook for the pumpkin latte launch.

children.text: Script: ‚ÄòWatch beans turn to pumpkin magic in 10 sec.‚Äô Visual: slow-mo latte art swirl ‚ûú quick pumpkin stencil ‚ûú sip and smile. Hashtags: #PumpkinDevOps #BeanFlow #FallFuel

messages.text: Draft a 120-word Q3 update for investors. Mention franchise revenue growth.

children.text: CityBean Coffee closed Q3 with 17% franchise revenue growth, fueled by 4 new caf√©s and 11% same-store sales lift. BeanFlow optimized roast cycles, cutting waste by 6 %. Loyalty app hit 210 k MAUs, and TikTok engagement tripled. We remain on track for 40 locations by FY-end and continue to reinvest in sustainable sourcing.

messages.text: Write email + IG copy for Saturday‚Äôs latte art class with Eventbrite link https://evt.bz/latte-art.

children.text: Email subject: ‚ÄòFoam Like a Pro This Saturday‚Äô. Body: ‚ÄòLearn rosettas & hearts from our champion baristas. 9 AM at Flagship Caf√©. Seats limited ‚ûú RSVP‚Äô. IG caption: ‚ÄòFrom bean to art ‚Äì master latte art 6/8 ‚òïüé® Sign-up in bio‚Äô.

messages.text: Compare BellaVista vs Alianza Colombian suppliers on cost and quality.

children.text: BellaVista: $4.12/lb, 87 SCA score, 3-day lead. Alianza: $4.28/lb, 88 SCA, 7-day lead. Switching fully to BellaVista cuts COGS 4 % with negligible taste delta.

messages.text: Rewrite loyalty FAQ and add Spanish translation.

children.text:
Updated FAQ:
1. How do I earn Beans? ‚Äî Earn 1 Bean per $1.
2. How to redeem? ‚Äî 50 Beans = free drink.
(Spanish below.)

1. ¬øC√≥mo gano Beans? ‚Äî 1 Bean por cada $1.
2. ¬øC√≥mo canjeo? ‚Äî 50 Beans = bebida gratis.

messages.text: Compress 4-page opening SOP into a 1-page printable.

children.text:
1. Power-on espresso & grinders
2. Calibrate shots (¬±1 s)
3. Prep milk jugs & alt-milks
4. Stock pastry case
5. Run waste check
6. Open POS lane
7. Team huddle (2 min).

messages.text: Need 3-minute voice-over script introducing BeanFlow basics.

children.text:
[0:00-0:30] Welcome & mission
[0:30-1:30] BeanFlow dashboard tour (live KPIs, roast planning)
[1:30-2:15] Loyalty & POS integration
[2:15-3:00] Support & next steps. End with call-to-action: ‚ÄòLog in and explore your first KPI pulse.‚Äô

messages.text: POS timestamps show drive-thru delays at Store #12. Root cause?

children.text: Median order-to-pay is 88 s (target 60 s). Grinder B cleaning at 10 AM added 22 s per drink. Recommend schedule cleaning at 14 PM and retrain baristas on dual-grinder workflow.

messages.text: Starbucks raised latte prices. Summarize impact on our margins.

children.text: Starbucks +$0.40 average. Our price gap widens to $0.25. Maintaining current pricing yields +6 % perceived value; we can absorb up to +$0.15 without losing parity.

messages.text: Pitch 5 winter drinks; Ops to check COGS.

children.text:
1. Fireside Mocha
2. Cardamom Cold Brew
3. Cranberry White Flat
4. Ginger Snap Latte
5. Midnight Mint. Avg COGS: 28-32 %.

messages.text: OT cost spiked yesterday. What happened?

children.text: Sick leave overlap at Stores #2 & #6 caused double OT shifts (12 h). Alert sent to scheduling bot to auto search swaps.

messages.text: Crash logs attached. Format GitHub issue.

children.text: Created issue #245: ‚ÄòNullPointer in RewardsManager.onLogin‚Äô. Steps to reproduce, stack trace, severity high, assignee @mobile-team.

messages.text: Give bullet outline for board deck with chart placeholders.

children.text:
Slide 1: Title + FY context
Slide 2: 12-mo SSS trend [chart]
Slide 3: Drivers (loyalty, menu)
Slide 4: Regional split [heatmap]
Slide 5: Action plan & targets.

messages.text: Draft spec & scoring matrix for new grinders.

children.text: Spec: 2.5 g/s grind speed, 0.1 s tolerance, IoT telemetry. Scoring: Cost 30 %, Durability 30 %, Consistency 25 %, Service 15 %. Template sheet attached.

messages.text: Reformat HACCP section to bullets, update FDA temps.

children.text:
Critical temps:
‚Ä¢ Milk ‚â§ 41 ¬∞F
‚Ä¢ Poultry ‚â• 165 ¬∞F
‚Ä¢ Cooling 135 ‚Üí 70 ¬∞F in 2 h.
Added checklist for daily log sign-off.

messages.text: Futures price dropped. Should we lock Q1 contracts?

children.text: ICE Arabica fell 6 % to $1.48/lb. Locking 70 % of Q1 volume now saves ~$42 k vs last contract; reserve 30 % for possible further dips.

messages.text: Need ad copy + alt text for Shopify banner.

children.text: Banner text: ‚ÄòWrap Joy in a Cup ‚Äì Gift Cards Now Live‚Äô. Alt: ‚ÄòHand holding CityBean digital gift card with snowflake overlay‚Äô.

messages.text: Drawer variance $180 yesterday. Outline investigation steps.

children.text:
1. Pull CCTV 18:00-22:00
2. Compare POS voids
3. Interview closers
4. Audit cash log vs deposits. Email template drafted for manager.

messages.text: Convert Excel royalty logic into SQL and validate.

children.text: SQL snippet: `SELECT sales*0.05 AS royalty FROM monthly_sales WHERE franchisee_id=?`. Validated 50 sample rows ‚Äì matches Excel within 0.01 %.

messages.text: Oat-milk share up 11 %. Show cost impact and draft renegotiation email.

children.text: Cost impact: +$0.032 per drink, +$7.8k/mo. Draft email: ‚ÄòVolume up 11 %, seeking bulk price adjustment to $1.82/L. Happy to extend contract 12 mo.‚Äô

messages.text: Need 400-word sustainability recap.

children.text: [Opening] In 2025 CityBean composted 92 t of grounds, offset 480 t CO‚ÇÇ, and sourced 86 % Rainforest Alliance beans‚Ä¶ [truncated at 400 words].

messages.text: Forecast sunny weekend. Craft geo SMS offers.

children.text: SMS: ‚Äò‚òÄÔ∏è Sun bonus! Flash this text for BOGO cold brew today only‚Äô. Geo-target: caf√©s within 5 mi of parks.
What if it‚Äôs super hot‚Äîany tweak?
Swap the offer to iced: ‚ÄúFree cold-foam upgrade‚Äù or ‚Äú$1 off any iced latte.‚Äù It converts well without stressing espresso throughput.
Any operational prep we should do before sending it?
Prep extra cold brew + ice, pre-batch simple syrups, and add 1 runner 12‚Äì3. Quick win: stage cups/lids by the bar to cut grab-time.

messages.text: Tally votes & tweet winner copy.

children.text: Votes: Aria (35), Leo (29), Mina (27). Tweet: ‚Äòüéâ Congrats Aria ‚Äì our Latte-Art champ! Check her swan pour this weekend.‚Äô
Can we add a short follow-up post to drive foot traffic?
‚ÄúAria‚Äôs swan pour is on the menu today. Ask for the ‚ÄòSwan Latte‚Äô at any CityBean and we‚Äôll donate $1 to the local food bank.‚Äù
How do we keep stores consistent on the ‚ÄòSwan Latte‚Äô?
Make it a vanilla oat latte with a cinnamon stencil. 3-step card + 20-sec training clip is enough for consistency across shifts.

messages.text: A/B test subject lines for matcha promo; pick winner.

children.text: Tested ‚ÄòMeet Your Matcha‚Äô (32% open) vs ‚ÄòGreen Goodness Inside‚Äô (24%). Choose ‚ÄòMeet Your Matcha‚Äô.
Why did ‚ÄòMeet Your Matcha‚Äô win?
It‚Äôs specific, playful, and it clearly signals matcha. The other reads generic/health-y, which tends to underperform for us.
Give me 2 more short subjects in the same vibe.

1) ‚ÄúMatcha, Meet Your Morning‚Äù
2) ‚ÄúWhisked. Iced. Perfect.‚Äù

messages.text: Managers PTO overlaps next week. Propose swap and notify HR.

children.text: Suggested swap: Miller (North Side) trades with Patel (Riverside) for Wed-Thu. Notification email queued to HR + both managers.
Any risk with that swap?
Only risk is Riverside‚Äôs Thursday delivery window. Patel knows that store better, so I‚Äôd keep Patel on Thu and swap only Wed if needed.
Who should cover openings if someone calls out?
Assign the senior shift lead as opener with a checklist + manager-on-call for approvals. It keeps the line moving and avoids cash drawer delays.

messages.text: Summarize CRM pipeline: hot leads and legal review.

children.text: 6 hot leads (Austin, Denver, Boise...) and 3 in legal (Phoenix, Tampa, Tacoma). Visual pipeline chart attached.
If we can only prioritize one city this month, which should it be?
Denver. Strong foot-traffic comps, higher average ticket, and fewer direct ‚Äúpremium drive‚Äëthru‚Äù competitors in our target neighborhoods.
What‚Äôs the fastest next step to move it forward?
Book a 30‚Äëmin site-selection call + send the unit economics one‚Äëpager (build cost, staffing model, break-even month). Keep it simple and concrete.

messages.text: Heatmap shows dead corner. Suggest merch move.

children.text: Relocate pastry display to north wall, shift merch to entry sightline. Expected uplift: +7 % pastry sales.
What merch should go closest to the entrance?
High-impulse, low-decision: beans (best sellers), cold cups, and gift cards. Keep ‚Äúpremium‚Äù items (brewers) one step deeper so people pause.
How do we know if it worked?
Track attach-rate (merch per ticket) and time-in-queue. BeanFlow can compare 7-day pre/post for the same dayparts to avoid weekend bias.

messages.text: Draft 1-page 2026 vision + CapEx forecast appendix.

children.text: Vision: 40 caf√©s, 60% app orders, zero waste-to-landfill. CapEx: $3.4 M equipment, $1.2 M IT, $0.6 M training. Memo draft attached.
Give me the one-sentence vision we can put on slide 1.
‚ÄúBuild the most operationally excellent neighborhood caf√© brand ‚Äî fast, consistent, and locally loved ‚Äî powered by real-time data.‚Äù
Top 3 priorities for Q1?

1) Reduce waste by 3 pts (training + forecasting)
2) Speed up drive‚Äëthru by 10 s (bar layout + staffing)
3) Grow app reorder rate (better offers + smoother pickup).

messages.text: What is CityBean Coffee?

children.text: CityBean Coffee is a fast-growing regional chain with 17 company-owned caf√©s and 24 franchise locations, powered by BeanFlow ‚Äî our in-house ops platform for POS + loyalty + real-time dashboards.
What‚Äôs your most popular drink?
Classic oat latte. Fun fact: we use a slightly longer ratio for better sweetness without extra syrup.
Do you roast your own beans?
Yes ‚Äî we roast centrally and tune profiles by region. BeanFlow tracks yield + waste so we can adjust week to week.
Any recommendation for someone who likes sweet coffee?
Try a vanilla cold brew with a splash of oat. It‚Äôs sweet, but still tastes like coffee.
What‚Äôs BeanFlow, in plain English?
It‚Äôs our internal ‚Äúops brain‚Äù: it connects sales, inventory, staffing, and quality checks so managers spot issues early (like a waste spike or a drive‚Äëthru slowdown).
When‚Äôs the best time to avoid lines?
Mid‚Äëmorning (9:30‚Äì11) is usually calm. If you do hit a rush, our bar layout is optimized for fast milk + espresso handoffs.

messages.text: 3-day finance snapshot since the Pumpkin Latte launch

children.text:
‚òï Pumpkin Latte Kick-off (last 3 days)

| Metric | Value | Œî vs prior 3-day |
|---|---:|---:|
| Net sales | $312k | +18% |
| Gross margin | 62.4% | ‚Üî |
| Promo spend | $7.8k | n/a |
| Net profit | $187k | +19% |

Bottom line: **+$41k** in profit in 72 hours.
Why is gross margin flat even though sales jumped?

Two likely drivers: (1) promo mix (more discounts + add-ons like alt milks) kept margin rate steady, and (2) pumpkin COGS is a bit higher than baseline drinks. Net profit still rose because volume covered it.

If you want a quick fix: cap discounting during peak hours and push higher-margin modifiers (extra shot) instead of syrup-heavy upsells.
